title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement explore.statistics@education.gov.uk. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

what: Why are these changes being made?
title: Brief overview of changes
EES API workflow
text: data sets EES available via EES API. maintain minimum standards around API data catalogue. Assuming know data set within publication like query, first need identify data set ID code. two methods , either ) via data set’s page EES website b) querying API .

what: Identifying a data set ID via the API
title: EES API workflow
text: Finding data set ID via API two step process. First, ’ll need find parent publication ID second, ’ll need search data catalogue within publication data set. Querying publication list: returns list publications ID title (along slug, summary date last published). list, can find title publication ’re interested pick associated publication ID. example test list, can pick “Pupil attendance schools”, ID 9676af6b-d563-41f4-d071-08da8f468680. can now use function eesyapi::get_data_catalogue() find data sets within publication: returns data frame containing data set IDs titles (along summary, status information ’s latest version). data set IDs can used shown following sections get given data set’s summary meta data, query data set .

what: Finding a data set ID on the EES website
title: EES API workflow
text: data set, can find API data set EES data catalogue. know name, can filter catalogue normal. data sets accessible via API, filter just , click “API data sets ” option shown image . ’ve found data set need, click title data set taken ’s details page catalogue. page (pictured ), ’ll find API data set quick start section, gives API data set name, API data set ID API data set version. API data set ID ’s needed query data set meta data.

title: EES API workflow
text: EES API option preview underlying data given data set. bypasses use IDs, making simpler short-term option explore available data. Using eesyapi, can preview data set using preview_dataset() providing data set ID follows: return data frame containing first 10 rows data form DfE analysts uploaded EES . can set n_max Inf, get whole data set using , avoid relying preview_dataset() function pipelines dashboards instead use explore data create custom query using query_dataset(). read whole file using preview risk: code breaking whenever element labels change reading much data active memory, causing R slow even crash

what: Getting the data set meta data
title: EES API workflow
text: querying data set via API, column names (indicators filters) options available within columns (filter items) referenced using auto-generated ID codes (known SQIDs). Therefore, order construct query involves selecting subset filter items indicators, ’ll need obtain IDs associated elements. IDs stored data set’s meta data, can also queried via API. get IDs well details time periods geographic levels locations available given data set, can use function eesyapi::get_meta(), providing data set’s ID. example, get “attendance schools” data example attendance API data publication, can take data set ID 63629501-d3ca-c471-9780-ec4cb6fdf172 provide parameter get_meta: function returns list 5 data frames: $time_periods: label, code period available time periods data set $locations: geographic_level, code, label item_id available locations data set $filter_columns: col_name label filters data set $filter_items: col_name, item_label, item_id default_item filter items data set $indicators: col_name label indicators data set item_id values provided $locations $filter_items required construct queries filtering given data set, whilst time periods can filtered values $time_period code column. example, let’s say ’ve run eesyapi::get_meta("63629501-d3ca-c471-9780-ec4cb6fdf172") want filter data set obtain data : “Week 24” time period “2024”, “York” “England” geographies, “Absence” Attendance status “Approved educational activity”, “Authorised” “Unauthorised” Attendance type Just “possible sessions” entry “attendance_reason” “Year date” “time_frame” want see “Number sessions” data values. need following codes / item_ids: “W5 2025” “BT7J3” “dP0Zw” “e4wuS” “P9Aeb”, “1Dui3”, “oRfmX” “RaVka” “4yTUZ” “X9fKb” Note whilst IDs unique within given item type (e.g. filter_item), necessarily unique types. example, given indicator assigned ID filter_item given data set. quick example might quickly query meta data codes, try following example pieces query code.

what: Querying a data set using parameters
title: EES API workflow
text: query_dataset() can given set parameters build query . Behind scenes creates JSON string based parameters provided user. inherently limits extent type queries can perform, cover basic use cases. parameters ’ll can provide build query : - time_periods - locations - filter_items - indicators (required) optional, except indicators must always specify. don’t provide time_periods, locations filter_items, ’ll receive rows data set (although careful, may take time larger data sets). don’t generally need use IDs filter columns query needs know options want select columns (filter items). Using parameters obtained get-meta , can create query return session count data Approved educational activity, Authorised Unauthorised Absences category, Nationally York Week 4 2025, supply following: notes : indicators, time_periods, geographies filter_items can supplied vectors - c(...) - interpreted filter(... %% c(...)). filter_items can supplied list create stringent cross-filter combinations, .e.  example rows returned specific combinations given across 4 filters. geographies can supplied data frame allow complex queries “give LAs given region”. structure can seen calling example_geography_query().

what: Why do you use IDs rather than the actual labels used in the data?
title: EES API workflow
text: IDs intended aid future proofing users may develop automated pipelines connect EES API. Labeling inevitably changes, example “Total” entry renamed “pupils” “schools” add clarity. underlying content item stays , automated pipelines required still connect item, therefore item associated ID remain unchanged given data set updated new data subsequent releases, even renaming field occurs.

what: Generate an EES API URL — api_url
title: Generate an EES API URL — api_url
text: function returns single URL connect chosen EES API endpoint. resulting URL can used GET POST (appropriate) order connect. Whether publication_id dataset_id (neither) parameter required depends endpoint chose.

title: Generate an EES API URL — api_url
code: api_url(   endpoint = "get-publications",   search = NULL,   publication_id = NULL,   dataset_id = NULL,   indicators = NULL,   time_periods = NULL,   geographic_levels = NULL,   locations = NULL,   filter_items = NULL,   dataset_version = NULL,   ees_environment = NULL,   api_version = NULL,   page_size = NULL,   page = NULL,   verbose = FALSE )

title: Generate an EES API URL — api_url
text: endpoint Name endpoint, can "get-publications", "get-data-catalogue", "get-dataset-versions", "get-summary", "get-meta", "get-csv", "get-data" "post-data" "get-summary", "get-meta", "get-csv", "get-data" "post-data" search String filtering publication list publication titles summaries containing search string provided (strings separated spaces combined logic). publication_id ID publication connected . required endpoint "get-data-catalogue" dataset_id ID data set connected . required endpoint one "get-dataset-versions", "get-summary", "get-meta", "get-csv", "get-data" "post-data" indicators Indicators required string vector strings (required) time_periods Time periods required string ("period|code") vector strings geographic_levels Geographic levels required string vector strings locations Location code required string vector strings filter_items Filter items required string vector strings dataset_version Version data set connected ees_environment EES ees_environment connect : "dev", "test", "preprod" "prod" api_version EES API version page_size Number results return single query page Page number query results return verbose Run additional contextual messaging. Logical, default = FALSE

title: Generate an EES API URL — api_url
text: string containing URL connecting EES API

title: Generate an EES API URL — api_url
code: api_url() #> [1] "https://api.education.gov.uk/statistics/v1/publications?" api_url("get-publications") #> [1] "https://api.education.gov.uk/statistics/v1/publications?" api_url("get-data-catalogue", publication_id = eesyapi::example_id("publication")) #> [1] "https://api.education.gov.uk/statistics/v1/publications/9676af6b-d563-41f4-d071-08da8f468680/data-sets?" api_url("get-summary", dataset_id = eesyapi::example_id("dataset")) #> [1] "https://api.education.gov.uk/statistics/v1/data-sets/55629501-e98b-0c75-adba-f95a0cfbb5e9" api_url("get-meta", dataset_id = eesyapi::example_id("dataset")) #> [1] "https://api.education.gov.uk/statistics/v1/data-sets/55629501-e98b-0c75-adba-f95a0cfbb5e9/meta" api_url("get-csv", dataset_id = eesyapi::example_id("dataset")) #> [1] "https://api.education.gov.uk/statistics/v1/data-sets/55629501-e98b-0c75-adba-f95a0cfbb5e9/csv" api_url(   "get-data",   dataset_id = eesyapi::example_id("dataset"),   indicators = example_id("indicator"),   time_periods = c("2024|W12", "2024|W13"),   geographic_levels = c("NAT"),   filter_items = example_id("filter_item") ) #> [1] "https://api.education.gov.uk/statistics/v1/data-sets/55629501-e98b-0c75-adba-f95a0cfbb5e9/query?timePeriods.in=2024|W12%2C2024|W13&geographicLevels.in=NAT&filters.in=oUXmX&indicators=uxo41" api_url(   "post-data",   dataset_id = eesyapi::example_id("dataset"),   indicators = example_id("indicator") ) #> [1] "https://api.education.gov.uk/statistics/v1/data-sets/55629501-e98b-0c75-adba-f95a0cfbb5e9/query"

title: Example ID — example_id
text: function returns examples working IDs can used eesyapi functions, query_dataset().

title: Example ID — example_id
text: level Level ID example return. range available, although every example group necessarily contains possible examples. following generally available. "": Return full list example options given group. "publication": Return example publication ID "dataset": Return example data set ID "time_period" / "time_periods": Return example time_period(s) "location_id" / "location_ids": Return example location ID(s) "location_code / location_codes": Return example location code(s) "filter": Return example filter column ID "filter_item" / "filter_items_short" / "filter_items_long": Return example filter ID example short / long filter query list. "indicator": Return example indicator ID ees_environment Environment return working example : "dev", "test" "prod" group Choose publication group examples use. Options : "attendance": Large example data set, careful ask "public-api-testing": Smaller example data set

title: Example ID — example_id
text: String, vector list containing example ID(s) present API

what: Query a data set using GET and a query URL — get_dataset
title: Query a data set using GET and a query URL — get_dataset
text: function provides method generating sending URL based data query EES API. minimum, requires dataset_id indicators flags provided. Note GET command limited level logic can process. example way using GET make query combines different filters logic. give GET set filter items search , can return rows containing items.

title: Query a data set using GET and a query URL — get_dataset
code: get_dataset(   dataset_id,   indicators,   time_periods = NULL,   geographic_levels = NULL,   locations = NULL,   filter_items = NULL,   dataset_version = NULL,   ees_environment = NULL,   api_version = NULL,   page = NULL,   page_size = 10000,   parse = TRUE,   verbose = FALSE )

title: Query a data set using GET and a query URL — get_dataset
text: dataset_id ID data set connected . required endpoint one "get-dataset-versions", "get-summary", "get-meta", "get-csv", "get-data" "post-data" indicators Indicators required string vector strings (required) time_periods Time periods required string ("period|code") vector strings geographic_levels Geographic levels required string vector strings locations Location code required string vector strings filter_items Filter items required string vector strings dataset_version Version data set connected ees_environment EES ees_environment connect : "dev", "test", "preprod" "prod" api_version EES API version page Page number query results return page_size Number results return single query parse Logical flag activate parsing results. Default: TRUE verbose Run additional contextual messaging. Logical, default = FALSE

title: Query a data set using GET and a query URL — get_dataset
text: Data frame containing query results API data set

title: Query a data set using GET and a query URL — get_dataset

title: Get data set versions — get_dataset_versions

title: Get data set versions — get_dataset_versions
text: dataset_id ID data set connected . required endpoint one "get-dataset-versions", "get-summary", "get-meta", "get-csv", "get-data" "post-data" detail Level detail return. Given character string, one : "light" (default) "full". Using "light" gives following: version - version number type - version type (major minor) total_rows - total number rows listed version release_date - release date data set version release_name - name release data set version published time_period_start - first available time period data time_period_start - latest available time period data Using "full" adds following addition : version_id - unique ID code data set version status - publication status data set version geographic_levels - geographic levels provided filters - names filters data set version indicators - names indicators data set version notes - additional information ees_environment EES ees_environment connect : "dev", "test", "preprod" "prod" api_version EES API version page_size Number results return single query page Page number query results return verbose Run additional contextual messaging. Logical, default = FALSE

title: Get data set versions — get_dataset_versions
text: data frame X columns: Data frame listing available versions given data set

Logical, default = FALSE

title: Create a json query — parse_tojson_params
text: indicators Indicators required string vector strings (required) time_periods Time periods required string ("period|code") vector strings geographies String, vector data frame containing geographic levels locations queried. filter_items Filter items required string vector strings page Page number query results return page_size Number results return single query debug Run POST query debug mode. title: Create a json query — parse_tojson_params
code: eesyapi:::parse_tojson_params(example_id("indicator")) |>   cat() #> { #>  #> "indicators": [ #>   "uxo41" #> ], #> "debug": false, #> "page": 1, #> "pageSize": 1000 #> }  eesyapi:::parse_tojson_params(   example_id("indicator"),   time_periods = "2024|W23",   geographies = c("NAT|id|dP0Zw", "REG|id|rg3Nj"),   filter_items = c("pmRSo", "7SdXo") ) |>   cat() #> { #> "criteria": { #>   "and": [ #>     { #>       "timePeriods": { #>         "in": [ #>           { #>             "period": "2024", #>             "code": "W23" #>           } #>         ] #>       } #>     }, #>     { #>       "or": [ #>         { #>           "and": [ #>         { #>           "geographicLevels": { #>             "eq": "NAT" #>           } #>         }, #>     { #>       "locations": { #>         "in": [ #>           { #>             "level": "NAT", #>             "id": "dP0Zw" #>           } #>         ] #>       } #>     } #>   ] #>   }, #>         { #>           "and": [ #>         { #>           "geographicLevels": { #>             "eq": "REG" #>           } #>         }, #>     { #>       "locations": { #>         "in": [ #>           { #>             "level": "REG", #>             "id": "rg3Nj" #>           } #>         ] #>       } #>     } #>   ] #>   } #>     ] #>   }, #>     { #>       "filters": { #>         "in": [ #>           "pmRSo", #>           "7SdXo" #>         ] #>       } #>     } #>   ] #> }, #> "indicators": [ #>   "uxo41" #> ], #> "debug": false, #> "page": 1, #> "pageSize": 1000 #> }  # Create a geographies data frame to find both of: #   - England national level data #   - all LAs in a specified region ("E12000004") dfgeographies <- data.frame(   geographic_level = c("NAT", "LA"),   location_level = c("NAT", "REG"),   location_id_type = c("code", "code"),   location_id = c("E92000001", "E12000004") )  eesyapi:::parse_tojson_params(   example_id("indicator"),   time_periods = "2024|W23",   geographies = dfgeographies,   filter_items = c("pmRSo") ) |>   cat() #> { #> "criteria": { #>   "and": [ #>     { #>       "timePeriods": { #>         "in": [ #>           { #>             "period": "2024", #>             "code": "W23" #>           } #>         ] #>       } #>     }, #>     { #>       "or": [ #>         { #>           "and": [ #>         { #>           "geographicLevels": { #>             "eq": "NAT" #>           } #>         }, #>     { #>       "locations": { #>         "in": [ #>           { #>             "level": "NAT", #>             "code": "E92000001" #>           } #>         ] #>       } #>     } #>   ] #>   }, #>         { #>           "and": [ #>         { #>           "geographicLevels": { #>             "eq": "LA" #>           } #>         }, #>     { #>       "locations": { #>         "in": [ #>           { #>             "level": "REG", #>             "code": "E12000004" #>           } #>         ] #>       } #>     } #>   ] #>   } #>     ] #>   }, #>     { #>       "filters": { #>         "in": [ #>           "pmRSo" #>         ] #>       } #>     } #>   ] #> }, #> "indicators": [ #>   "uxo41" #> ], #> "debug": false, #> "page": 1, #> "pageSize": 1000 #> }  # Create a filter list to find the combination of: #   - day_number is in c("uLQo4", "qf0jG", "aMjLP") *and* #   - reason is in c("bBrtT", "ThjPJ", "hsHyW", "m2m9K") *and* #   - education_phase is in c("5UNdi", "crH31") filter_list <- list(   day_number = c("uLQo4", "qf0jG", "aMjLP"),   reason = c("bBrtT", "ThjPJ", "hsHyW", "m2m9K"),   education_phase = c("5UNdi", "crH31") )  eesyapi:::parse_tojson_params(   example_id("indicator"),   time_periods = "2024|W23",   geographies = "NAT|code|E92000001",   filter_items = filter_list ) |>   cat() #> { #> "criteria": { #>   "and": [ #>     { #>       "timePeriods": { #>         "in": [ #>           { #>             "period": "2024", #>             "code": "W23" #>           } #>         ] #>       } #>     }, #>     { #>       "or": [ #>         { #>           "and": [ #>         { #>           "geographicLevels": { #>             "eq": "NAT" #>           } #>         }, #>     { #>       "locations": { #>         "in": [ #>           { #>             "level": "NAT", #>             "code": "E92000001" #>           } #>         ] #>       } #>     } #>   ] #>   } #>     ] #>   }, #> { #> "and": [ #>     { #>       "filters": { #>         "in": [ #>           "uLQo4", #>           "qf0jG", #>           "aMjLP" #>         ] #>       } #>     }, #>     { #>       "filters": { #>         "in": [ #>           "bBrtT", #>           "ThjPJ", #>           "hsHyW", #>           "m2m9K" #>         ] #>       } #>     }, #>     { #>       "filters": { #>         "in": [ #>           "5UNdi", #>           "crH31" #>         ] #>       } #>     } #> ] #> } #>   ] #> }, #> "indicators": [ #>   "uxo41" #> ], #> "debug": false, #> "page": 1, #> "pageSize": 1000 #> }

what: Preview the raw CSV for an API data set — preview_dataset
title: Preview the raw CSV for an API data set — preview_dataset
text: function mostly designed exploring API, unlikely suitable long term production use. can set number rows preview using n_max parameter. uses n_max readr::read_csv() hood. IDs involved, brittle code relying function likely break whenever renaming variables items data. recommended take time set custom queries using query_dataset() function instead. using function exploratory purposes, make sure subscribe data set downloading keep track updates data.

title: Preview the raw CSV for an API data set — preview_dataset
code: preview_dataset(   dataset_id,   dataset_version = NULL,   api_version = NULL,   ees_environment = default_ees_environment(),   n_max = 10,   verbose = FALSE )

title: Preview the raw CSV for an API data set — preview_dataset
text: dataset_id ID data set dataset_version Version number data set api_version EES API version ees_environment EES ees_environment connect : "dev", "test", "preprod" "prod" n_max maximum number rows preview, 10 default, Inf get available rows verbose Run additional contextual messaging, logical, default = FALSE

title: Preview the raw CSV for an API data set — preview_dataset
text: data.frame

title: Preview the raw CSV for an API data set — preview_dataset
text: gives super quick way just fetch file human readable format.

title: Query a data set — query_dataset
text: Create send query EES API. Queries can supplied run one 4 ways: Supplying json query file sent POST method. Supplying json query string variable sent POST method. Supplying parameters (time_periods, geographies, filter_items, indicators) build json query sent POST method. Supplying parameters (time_periods, geographies, filter_items, indicators) build json query sent GET method. cases, data set id must supplied explicitly using dataset_id. Details format parameter latter two methods follows.

title: Query a data set — query_dataset
text: must supplied vector sqids, can identified meta data using get_meta().

title: Query a data set — query_dataset
text: Time periods supplied vector periods codes form: "period|code" example, selecting 2023 2024 academic years require: time_period = c("2023|AY", "2024|AY")

title: Query a data set — query_dataset
text: Geographies can supplied single string, vector strings, list data frame depending user preference complexity desired query. user can supply single string containing desired geographic level (e.g. "NAT", "REG", "LA") specific location (e.g. "NAT|code|E92000001", "REG|code|E12000001") query search rows single level location. Specific locations required supplied format "location_level|location_id_type|location_id", location_id_type can either code id corresponding location_id standard ONS code sqid given meta data respectively. Using England example, : "NAT|code|E92000001" "NAT|id|dP0Zw" Using vector run query returning rows meeting given geographies, .e. geographies = c("NAT", "REG") return national regional level rows, whilst c("NAT", "REG|code|E120000001") return national level rows North East rows. require complex selection, example LAs given region, data frame supplied, row selection. Note however, work best using default POST method. GET method much limited may struggle process complex queries. geography query data frame contain following columns: geographic_level: geographic level return (e.g. LA example ). location_level: geographic level search location (e.g. REG example ). location_id_type: "code" "id". location_id: code id (sqid) search location (e.g. code sqid region example). rows can added add geography searches include results. example working geographies data frame can obtained using example_geography_query(). list object also understood, provided contains named items geographic_level / location. defined similarly vector form : list(geographic_level=c("REG", "LA"), locations = c("REG|code|E12000001")

title: Query a data set — query_dataset
text: Similarly geographies, criteria querying filter items can provided either via vector simple queries , complex queries, list. cases, vector list, filter items can supplied sqids, .e. ids found meta data using get_meta(dataset_id). Providing vector sqids effectively run query returning rows containing listed sqids. therefore allow narrow searches based row set rows matching multiple criteria. Providing list structure can provide narrow query selecting individual rows based combination criteria. example want rows contain sqid1 one column sqid2 another, pass list : filter_query <- list(column1 = c("sqid1"), column2 = c("sqid2")) Note naming entries list necessary, may help creating readable code. wish create query whereby receive rows containing sqid1 column 1 sqid2 sqid3 column 2, required list : filter_query <- list(column1 = c("sqid1"), column2 = c("sqid2", "sqid3")) way, can build combinations criteria query across multiple filter columns. Note complex querying using list variable function using POST method.

title: Query a data set — query_dataset
text: can request specific set rows using page page_size parameters. Keeping default page = NULL return rows matching query. Setting page page_size numerical values attempt return subset rows, page_size defining number rows page defining subset rows return query (.e. page = 1, page_size = 20 return first 20 rows, page = 2 page_size = 20 return second 20 rows ).

title: Query a data set — query_dataset
code: query_dataset(   dataset_id,   indicators = NULL,   time_periods = NULL,   geographies = NULL,   filter_items = NULL,   json_query = NULL,   method = "POST",   dataset_version = NULL,   ees_environment = NULL,   api_version = NULL,   page_size = 10000,   page = NULL,   debug = FALSE,   verbose = FALSE )

title: Query a data set — query_dataset
text: dataset_id ID data set connected . required endpoint one "get-dataset-versions", "get-summary", "get-meta", "get-csv", "get-data" "post-data" indicators Indicators required string vector strings (required) time_periods Time periods required string ("period|code") vector strings geographies String, vector data frame containing geographic levels locations queried. filter_items Filter items required string vector strings json_query Optional path json file containing query parameters method API query method used. Can  "POST" "GET". Default: "POST". dataset_version Version data set connected ees_environment EES ees_environment connect : "dev", "test", "preprod" "prod" api_version EES API version page_size Number results return single query page Page number query results return debug Run POST query debug mode. Logical, default = FALSE verbose Run additional contextual messaging. Logical, default = FALSE

title: Query a data set — query_dataset
text: Data frame containing query results

title: Query a data set — query_dataset
code: # Run query_dataset() using a json query string input to json_query (this can also be done by # passing a filename of a file containing your json query string). query_dataset(   example_id(group = "attendance"),   json_query = example_json_query() ) #>    time_period time_identifier geographic_level nat_name  nat_code   reg_name #> 1         2025          Week 3         Regional  England E92000001 North East #> 2         2025          Week 3         Regional  England E92000001 North East #> 3         2025          Week 3         Regional  England E92000001 North East #> 4         2025 title: eesyapi 0.5.0
text: Updated output data parsing convert geographic_levels human friendly text Updated API base URLs environment planned live ones. Added search parameter get_publications() allow filtering publication title text. Cleaned behaviour query_dataset() use geographies parameter, rather geographies, locations geographic_levels. Moved background functions internal. Added specific warning message warns rows returned valid query.

title: eesyapi 0.4.0
text: Optimisation parsing JSON responses query_dataset() Rename download_dataset() preview_dataset() set default n_max 10 Move test data examples across EES test environment data sets Minor tweaks improvements documentation

title: eesyapi 0.3.1
text: Added parsing SQIDs retrieved data provide human readable content Created function, download_dataset(), connect csv endpoint downloading data set csv file Added first draft example workflow querying data set

title: eesyapi 0.3.0
text: query_dataset(): Now defaults using POST instead GET post_dataset(): Sends query data set, either using json file, json string parameters Updated example_id() works allow complex examples

title: eesyapi 0.2.1
text: Created initial query_dataset() function queries data set using get_dataset() Created get_dataset() function queries data set using GET URL parameters Updated get_meta() work new API meta output (addition id alongside col_name label) Removed redundant function: parse_meta_filter_columns() Hex logo added documentation

title: eesyapi 0.2.0
text: get_publication_catalogue(): Retrieve list available publications get_publication_datasets(): Retrieve list available data sets given publication example_id(): Provide example publication data set IDs (largely example code testing) api_url_pages(): Render string set paging API query results eesapi_url() -> api_url(): Name change function updated allow publication data set URLs warning_max_pages(): Check query page number exceeding total query pages available Added test data process maintaining data Added validate_ family validation helpers

title: eesyapi 0.1.0
text: get_meta(): primary function retrieving parsed R-friendly meta data get_meta_response(): underlying function retrieving meta data without full parsing parse_meta_location_ids(): convert location data initial meta response simple data frame parse_meta_filter_columns(): create data frame filter col_name label initial meta response parse_meta_filter_item_ids(): convert filter item data initial meta response simple data frame parse_meta_indicator_columns(): create data frame indicator col_name label initial meta response http_request_error(): render API url give endpoint / data set combination
